description:
Looks like there is a schema problem, noticed this on the postgres devstack gate run:

2013-08-26 23:59:45.136 20443 TRACE nova.openstack.common.rpc.amqp  'INSERT INTO instance_faults (created_at, updated_at, deleted_at, deleted, instance_uuid, code, message, details, host) VALUES (%(created_at)s, %(updated_at)s, %(deleted_at)s, %(deleted)s, %(instance_uuid)s, %(code)s, %(message)s, %(details)s, %(host)s) RETURNING instance_faults.id' {'instance_uuid': u'0c6641f4-6330-44eb-9280-41a016242c90', 'code': 500, 'deleted': 0, 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2013, 8, 26, 23, 59, 45, 33573), 'updated_at': None, 'host': u'devstack-precise-hpcloud-az1-173434', 'details': u'  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 256, in decorated_function
    return function(self, context, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1494, in run_instance
    do_run_instance()
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py", line 246, in inner
    return f(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1493, in do_run_instance
    legacy_bdm_in_spec)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 931, in _run_instance
    notify("error", msg=unicode(e))  # notify that build failed
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 915, in _run_instance
    instance, image_meta, legacy_bdm_in_spec)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1040, in _build_instance
    filter_properties, bdms, legacy_bdm_in_spec)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1071, in _reschedule_or_error
    instance, exc_info[1], exc_info=exc_info)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/utils.py", line 78, in add_instance_fault_from_exc
    conductor.instance_fault_create(context, values)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/conductor/api.py", line 111, in instance_fault_create
    return self._manager.instance_fault_create(context, values)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/conductor/rpcapi.py", line 358, in instance_fault_create
    return self.call(context, msg, version='1.36')
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/openstack/common/rpc/proxy.py", line 126, in call
    result = rpc.call(context, real_topic, msg, timeout)

    rv = list(rv)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/openstack/common/rpc/amqp.py", line 499, in __iter__
    raise result

title: value too long for type character varying(255)

comments.content:
Looks like there is a schema problem, noticed this on the postgres devstack gate run:

2013-08-26 23:59:45.136 20443 TRACE nova.openstack.common.rpc.amqp  'INSERT INTO instance_faults (created_at, updated_at, deleted_at, deleted, instance_uuid, code, message, details, host) VALUES (%(created_at)s, %(updated_at)s, %(deleted_at)s, %(deleted)s, %(instance_uuid)s, %(code)s, %(message)s, %(details)s, %(host)s) RETURNING instance_faults.id' {'instance_uuid': u'0c6641f4-6330-44eb-9280-41a016242c90', 'code': 500, 'deleted': 0, 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2013, 8, 26, 23, 59, 45, 33573), 'updated_at': None, 'host': u'devstack-precise-hpcloud-az1-173434', 'details': u'  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 256, in decorated_function
    return function(self, context, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1494, in run_instance
    do_run_instance()
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py", line 246, in inner
    return f(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1493, in do_run_instance
    legacy_bdm_in_spec)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 931, in _run_instance
    notify("error", msg=unicode(e))  # notify that build failed
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 915, in _run_instance
    instance, image_meta, legacy_bdm_in_spec)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1040, in _build_instance
    filter_properties, bdms, legacy_bdm_in_spec)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1071, in _reschedule_or_error
    instance, exc_info[1], exc_info=exc_info)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/utils.py", line 78, in add_instance_fault_from_exc
    conductor.instance_fault_create(context, values)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/conductor/api.py", line 111, in instance_fault_create
    return self._manager.instance_fault_create(context, values)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/conductor/rpcapi.py", line 358, in instance_fault_create
    return self.call(context, msg, version='1.36')
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/openstack/common/rpc/proxy.py", line 126, in call
    result = rpc.call(context, real_topic, msg, timeout)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/openstack/common/rpc/__init__.py", line 140, in call
    return _get_impl().call(CONF, context, topic, msg, timeout)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/openstack/common/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 828, in call
    rpc_amqp.get_connection_pool(conf, Connection))
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/openstack/common/rpc/amqp.py", line 534, in call
    rv = list(rv)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/openstack/common/rpc/amqp.py", line 499, in __iter__
    raise result

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~clint-fewbar

comments.content:
Looks like we're trying to shove a very long error message into instance_faults.message, which is a varchar(255).

Because there is also a details column with space for longer error messages, I think that 255 characters is plenty for the message field, and we should truncate oversized messages to fit.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dripton

comments.content: The reason this only shows up with PostgreSQL is that MySQL silently truncates overly-long inserts into VARCHAR fields by default.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dripton

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/44548
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/44548
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/21ec8a13be131c700023e97f8f55b34340dd73e8
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 21ec8a13be131c700023e97f8f55b34340dd73e8
Author: David Ripton <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Aug 30 16:38:20 2013 -0400

    Limit instance fault messages to 255 characters
    
    The instance_fault.message column is a VARCHAR(255).  By default,
    MySQL silently truncates entries that are too long.  PostgreSQL
    throws an error instead.  So we need to truncate the message field
    before we try inserting into that column, to avoid errors from
    very long messages in PostgreSQL (or MySQL configured to not allow
    this).
    
    Fixes bug #1217167
    
    Change-Id: Ia959d64a8bc162a33ba818f1006e9779207b4796
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
